edu.ucla.sspace.lra
Class LatentRelationalAnalysis

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.lra.LatentRelationalAnalysis

public class LatentRelationalAnalysis
extends Object

An implementation of Latent Relational Analysis (LRA). This implementation is based on two papers.

  • Peter D. Turney (2004). Human-Level Performance on Word Analogy Questions by Latent Relational Analysis. Available here
  • Peter D. Turney (2005). Measuring Semantic Similarity by Latent Relational Analysis. Available here

LRA uses three main components to analyze a large corpus of text in order to measure relational similarity between pairs of words (i.e. analogies). LRA uses the search engine to find patterns based on the input set as well as its corresponding alternates (see loadAnalogiesFromFile(String)). A sparse matrix is then generated, where each value in the matrix is the number of times the row's word pair occurs with the column's pattern between them.

After the matrix has been built, the Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) is used to reduce the dimensionality of the original word-document matrix, denoted as A. The SVD is a way of factoring any matrix A into three matrices U Σ VT such that Σ is a diagonal matrix containing the singular values of A. The singular values of Σ are ordered according to which causes the most variance in the values of A. The original matrix may be approximated by recomputing the matrix with only k of these singular values and setting the rest to 0. The approximated matrix Â = Uk Σk VkT is the least squares best-fit rank-k approximation of A. LRA reduces the dimensions by keeping only the first k dimensions from the row vectors of U and the k dimensions from the column vectors of Σ. The projection matrix UΣ is then used to calculate the relational similarities between pairs using the row vectors corresponding to the word pairs.

This class uses the Apache Lucune Search Engine for optimal indexing and filtering of word pairs using any given corpus. This class also uses Wordnet through the JAWS interface in order to find alternate word pairs from given input pairs.

Author:
Sky Lin

LatentRelationalAnalysis

public LatentRelationalAnalysis(String corpus_directory,
                                String index_directory,
                                boolean do_index)
Constructor for LatentRelationalAnalysis.

Parameters:
corpus_directory - a String containing the absolute path to the directory containing the corpus
index_directory - a String containing the absolute path to the directory where the index created by Lucene will be stored
do_index - true if the index step should be performed. false if the index file already exists under index_directory (will skip indexing step).
Method Detail

loadAnalogiesFromFile

public void loadAnalogiesFromFile(String analogy_file)
Loads the analogies from an input file. The file must contain word pairs in the form of A:B separated by newlines.

Parameters:
analogy_file - a String containing the absolute path to the analogy file.

findAlternatives

public static edu.smu.tspell.wordnet.Synset[] findAlternatives(String term)
Returns the synonyms for the specified term. The synonyms will be taken directly from the WordNet database. This is used by LRA to find alternative pairs. Given an input set of A:B. For each A' that is similar to A, make a new pair A':B. Likewise for B.

Parameters:
term - a String containing a single word
Returns:
an array of all the synonyms

initializeIndex

public static void initializeIndex(String indexDir,
                                   String dataDir)
Initializes an index given the index directory and data directory.

Parameters:
indexDir - a String containing the directory where the index will be stored
dataDir - a String containing the directory where the data is found

countPhraseFrequencies

public static float countPhraseFrequencies(String indexDir,
                                           String A,
                                           String B)
Searches an index given the index directory and counts up the frequncy of the two words used in a phrase.

Parameters:
indexDir - a String containing the directory where the index is stored
A - a String containing the first word of the phrase
B - a String containing the last word of the phrase
Returns:
float

filterPhrases

public static ArrayList<String> filterPhrases(String INDEX_DIR,
                                              String A,
                                              String B,
                                              edu.smu.tspell.wordnet.Synset[] A_prime,
                                              edu.smu.tspell.wordnet.Synset[] B_prime)
Returns an ArrayList of phrases with the greatest frequencies in the corpus. For each alternate pair, send a phrase query to the Lucene search engine containing the corpus. The phrase query will find the frequencies of phrases that begin with one member of the pair and end with the other. The phrases cannot have more than MAX_PHRASE words. Select the top NUM_FILTER (current NUM_FILTER=3) most frequent phrases and return them along with the original pairs. NOTE: should be called before findPatterns().

Parameters:
A - a String containing the first member in the original pair
B - a String containing the second member in the original pair
A_prime - a Synset array containing the alternates for A
B_prime - a Synset array containing the alternates for B
Returns:
an ArrayList of String with the top NUM_FILTER pairs along with the original pairs

findPatterns

public void findPatterns()
                  throws Exception
Finds patterns using the filtered phrases. Should be called after filterPhrases.

Throws:
Exception

mapColumns

public void mapColumns()
Maps a list of patterns to the columns of the sparse matrix. Takes the results of #findPattern() and maps it to the column indeces of a sparse matrix.

mapRows

public void mapRows()
Maps a list of phrases to the rows of the sparse matrix. Takes an ArrayList containing the filtered phrases (originals and alternates) and maps them to the sparse matrix.

Parameters:
phrases - an ArrayList containing the filtered phrases

createSparseMatrix

public Matrix createSparseMatrix()
Creates the sparse matrix. Should be called after findPatterns(), mapRows(), and mapColumns(). The returned Matrix should be used in the SVD process.

Returns:
the sparse Matrix.

applyEntropyTransformations

public Matrix applyEntropyTransformations(Matrix mat)
Applies log and entropy transformations to the sparse matrix [Landauer and Dumais, 1997].

Returns:
the sparse Matrix after log and entropy transformations.

computeCosineSimilarity

public double computeCosineSimilarity(String analogy,
                                      Matrix m)
Computes the cosine similarity of an analogy using the projection matrix. The relational similarity between A:B and C:D is the average of the cosines values between combinations of the similar pairs. The cosines from the similar pairs must be greater than or equal to the cosine of the original pairs, A:B and C:D.

Parameters:
analogy - a String containing the two pairs to compare. The analogy must be in the form A:B::C:D, where A:B and C:D are two analogies from the input set
m - the projection Matrix
Returns:
a double value containing the cosine similarity value of the analogy

computeSVD

public static Matrix[] computeSVD(Matrix sparse_matrix,
                                  int dimensions)
Does the Singular Value Decomposition using the generated sparse matrix. The dimensions used cannot exceed the number of columns in the original matrix.

Parameters:
sparse_matrix - the sparse Matrix
dimensions - the number of singular values to calculate
Returns:
a double containing the cosine similarity value of the analogy

evaluateAnalogies

public void evaluateAnalogies(Matrix projection,
                              String inputFileName,
                              String outputFileName)
Reads analogies from file and outputs their cosine similarities to another file.

Parameters:
projection - the projection Matrix
inputFileName - the input file containing analogies in the proper format separated by newlines
outputFileName - the output file where the results will be stored
See Also:
computeCosineSimilarity(String,Matrix)

isAnalogyFormat

public static boolean isAnalogyFormat(String analogy)
Checks whether the analogy is in the proper format. An analogy is in proper format if it contains two Strings separated by a colon (:)

Parameters:
analogy - a String containing the two pairs to compare. The analogy should be in the form A:B
Returns:
true if the analogy is in proper format

isAnalogyFormat

public static boolean isAnalogyFormat(String analogy,
                                      boolean pair)
Checks whether the analogy is in the proper format. An analogy is in proper format if it contains two Strings separated by a colon (:), or two colons (::) if it is a pair of analogies.

Parameters:
analogy - a String containing the two pairs to compare. The analogy should be in the form A:B if it is not a pair, or A:B::C:D if it is a pair of analogies.
pair - true if it is a pair of analogies
Returns:
true if the analogy is in proper format
